Open-Source Alternatives to Proprietary Enterprise Software

A collaborative list of open-source alternatives to typical government and enterprise software needs

Server

Operation System

Software Consider as Alternative to Comments Real-World Use
  • RedHat Enterprise Linux
  • Canonical Ubuntu Server
  • CentOs Linux
  • Novell SUSE Linux
  • Microsoft Windows Server
  • UNIX - Sun Solaris, IBM AIX, HP UX
  • General purpose Unix-like operating system with proven higher performance, availability and security record.
  • Enterprise Linux distributions are tested more than cutting edge distributions aimed at developers or home use.
  • CentOS is a rebuilt from RedHat enterprise versions of the source code but without Redhat trademarks, and usable without commercial support subscription costs.
  • London Stock Exchange has moved from a Microsoft .Netref based infrastructure to a Novell Linux based infrastructure to improve speed and stability.ref
  • Linux powers the global Wikipedia site.
  • CentOS is used by the Mexican Federal Power Commission.ref
  • Netcraft Survey March 2011 shows top 5 most reliable web hosting providers run Linux.ref
  • FreeBSD, NetBSD, OpenBSD
  • Microsoft Windows Server
  • UNIX - Sun Solaris, IBM AIX, HP UX
  • General purpose Unix-like operating system with proven performance, availability and security record.
  • BSDs have a particular record in internet and network services, and underly many commercial network products.
  • FreeBSD is considered stable and reliable and powers some of in internet’s busiest sites, including for a while Microsoft’s Hotmail.ref
  • Force10 routers and switches have an OS based on NetBSD.ref
  • FreeBSD used in products from major companies including Apple, Blue Coat, Citrix, Ironport, Juniper. McAfee and NetApp.ref
  • FreeBSD powers busy sites including Yahoo!ref
